question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: get_storage_fee_refund()] [Refund timing attack] Could get_storage_fee_refund() be called multiple times with different results due to state changes, allowing attacker to choose when to extract maximum refund? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: new()] [Refund carry-over] When creating a new EpilogueSession, could storage_refund from a previous session inadvertently carry over, giving undeserved refunds? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Struct: EpilogueSession] [Refund immutability] Is storage_refund immutable after session creation, or could it be modified through interior mutability or unsafe code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Status downgrade] Could execution_status be downgraded from failure to success between epilogue execution and VMOutput creation, hiding transaction failures? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Keep vs Discard manipulation] Since finish() always wraps execution_status in TransactionStatus::Keep, could this force keeping of transactions that should be discarded? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Execution status injection] Does finish() validate the execution_status parameter matches actual epilogue execution results, or could mismatched status be injected? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Fee statement bypass] Could the fee_statement parameter be a zero-valued FeeStatement allowing free transaction execution despite actual resource consumption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Gas component manipulation] Could individual components of FeeStatement (execution_gas, io_gas, storage_fee) be manipulated to pay less than actual consumption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Refund exceeding charge] Could storage_fee_refund_octas in the FeeStatement exceed total charges, causing the transaction to receive net payment instead of paying fees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Squashing idempotency] If finish_with_squashed_change_set() is non-idempotent, could calling finish() multiple times produce different results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Squashing error recovery] When finish_with_squashed_change_set() returns an error, is the original session state preserved or corrupted, and could this enable attack retry scenarios? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Empty change set handling] Does finish() handle empty change sets correctly, or could transactions with no state changes bypass important epilogue checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [UserSessionChangeSet validation timing] After finish_with_squashed_change_set() succeeds, could UserSessionChangeSet::new() reject the change_set leaving the system in an inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Config mismatch] Could different change_set_configs be used between finish_with_squashed_change_set() and UserSessionChangeSet::new(), causing validation inconsistencies? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Module write set reuse] When epilogue_session_change_set is unpacked, is the module_write_set properly consumed or could it be reused in another transaction? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: new()] [Respawn state pollution] When RespawnedSession::spawn() creates a session with previous_session_change_set, could malicious change sets pollute the respawned session's state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Struct: EpilogueSession] [Deref bypass] Through Deref/DerefMut, could external code call RespawnedSession methods that should only be accessible internally, breaking epilogue invariants? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: new()] [User context validation] Does as_user_transaction_context() properly validate transaction context before passing to RespawnedSession, or could invalid contexts cause session initialization failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Resource creation refund exploit] As noted in respawned_session.rs comments, could an attacker create a slot in user session, have another transaction delete it and claim refund, then recreate it in epilogue to repeatedly claim refunds? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Creation detection bypass] Could assert_no_additional_creation be bypassed by transactions that modify existing slots in ways that appear as modifications but are actually creations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [ModifyWithMetadata exploitation] Could the epilogue recreate deleted slots that carry original metadata, allowing refund claims without actual storage deletion? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Gas underflow] Could total_charge_gas_units underflow when storage_fee_octas is converted to gas units and subtracted, resulting in negative fees paid as large positive values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Gas unit price manipulation] Could gas_unit_price from transaction metadata be manipulated to pay less per unit, effectively getting discounted transaction execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Free transaction via refund] If storage_fee_refund_octas equals or exceeds total charges, could this result in free transaction execution or net payment to the sender? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/epilogue.rs] [Function: finish()] [Validator divergence] Could different validators produce different VMOutputs from finish() due to timing differences in when they execute the epilogue? (Critical)
